Package a12345678.change.to.your.matriculation.number

Class Spell

Object
Spell
Direct Known Subclasses:
AttackingSpell, HealingSpell, ProtectingSpell
public abstract class Spell extends Object
A Spell object generates a magic effect on a target. To cast a spell the caster has to provide sufficient mana and has to have the required magic level.

  • Constructor Details

    • Spell

      public Spell(String name, int manaCost, MagicLevel levelNeeded)
      Parameters:
      name - name
      manaCost - manaCost
      levelNeeded - levelNeeded to cast the spell

  • Method Details

    • cast

      public void cast(MagicSource source, MagicEffectRealization target)
      Ensure necessary magic level and get necessary energy by calling provideMana on source (this will typically reduce MP in source). If provideMana fails (returns false) cast is canceled otherwise the abstract method doEffect is called
      Parameters:
      source - caster of the spell
      target - target of the spell

    • doEffect

      public abstract void doEffect(MagicEffectRealization target)
      The actual effect of the spell on target must be implemented by the subclasses
      Parameters:
      target - target of the spell

    • additionalOutputString

      public String additionalOutputString()
      Returns ""; is overridden in deriving classes when needed
      Returns:
      ""

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Return output in format "['name'('levelNeeded'): 'manaCost' mana'additionalOutputString']"; where 'levelNeeded' is displayed as asterisks (see MagicLevel.toString) e.g. (full Output containing additionalOutputString) [Episkey(*): 5 mana; +20 HP]
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      "['name'('levelNeeded'): 'manaCost' mana'additionalOutputString']"
